tv.generator-info-name: Original XML Generated with Tempest EPG Generator (made by Kvanc) - Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v0.9

programme.title: rage New Country Special
programme.desc: rage lines up the best clips from the new generation of country music-megastars including Shaboozey, Morgan Wallen, Jellyroll, Luke Combs, Lainey Wilson and more.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Lorna Dunkley and Thomas Oriti present an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Ryan Hoffman, Catherine Murphy and Quentin Hull preview the Melbourne Storm v Brisbane Broncos in the NRL Grand Final and Roosters v Broncos in the NRLW decider in a special from Sydney Olympic Park.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Three Palestinian families whove fled the war in Gaza take us inside their lives. As they seek protection in Australia, presenter Patrick Abboud is by their side. A deeply personal film, and a side to this war we rarely see.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Tropical Food Forest and Mini Deck DIY
programme.desc: Costa lends Millie a hand to build a mini deck, Sophie visits a golf course growing endangered species, Hannah plants peas and beans, Tammy visits a tropical food forest, and we meet a botanist captivated by dragon trees.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Bridget and Graeme Clarkes to-do list is long and complicated: theyre selling a house, repairing a house and building a house all at the same time, within a very hopeful 12 month period.

programme.title: Love And Other Catastrophes
programme.desc: A day in the life of two film school students trying to find love and another housemate.

programme.title: The Art Of Hair
programme.desc: From mullets to afros, Namila Benson wants to know why were so obsessed with hair. She seeks answers with artist Patricia Piccinini, top model Duckie Thot, hair sculptor Zeina Thiboult and at Mullet Fest.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A grisly discovery in a College garden raises suspicion amongst a celebrated Oxford orchestra, but when a second tragedy hits, this time within their ranks, Endeavour discovers a story the ensemble would sooner forget.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Holowiliena was settled in 1853 by the Warwick family and their descendants still live on the property. With no money or heritage skills, can they save the original settlers buildings? (Final)

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.sub-title: Jude Perl, Joel Creasey, Johnny Took and Abbie Chatfield
programme.desc: Adam, Myf and Alan are joined by Jude Perl, Joel Creasey, Johnny Took and Abbie Chatfield. Plus, western swing with the Canyon Callers and so many Secret Song clues with Brian Mannix.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Nick Dole, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Dog Gone - The Hunt for Valerie
programme.desc: How the hunt for runaway sausage dog Valerie fired up the Kangaroo Island community and sparked headlines around the world.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: On an autumn morning at Port Arthurs historic convict settlement, a gunman walked into the Broad Arrow Cafe, killing 35 people. We go deep inside the experience, hear from first hand witnesses to understand what happened.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Gamers In The Wild: Social Gamers and Story Of Seasons!
programme.desc: This week: We live the simple life through the seasons in the latest life-sim Story of Seasons: Pioneers of Olive Town, plus we take a look into the world of the social gamer in their natural habitat in Gamers In The Wild!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Otto and Oscar try to stop Olive from turning into a pirate.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When the Bears beloved laptop breaks, they finally need to do something theyve never done before: get jobs. At a trendy cupcake shop, the Bears find that the working world is much tougher than they realised.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun makes a wish that changes everything, with unexpected consequences.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Merlin narrowly escapes with his life when he is attacked by a mysterious and terrifying creature with the body of an eagle and the head of a lion. At the last moment a young stranger appears and manages to fight the monster.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears, being an urban bunch, hadnt ever heard of hibernation until Chloe tells them about it. Grizz, loving the idea of eating a ton and then just sleeping to his hearts content, goes for it with reckless abandon.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A newcomer to Marinettes circle of friends gets akumatized into Sole Crusher, a giant supervillain who can absorb people. Will Ladybug and Cat Noir be up to the task?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sheeps field is in a mess, and the Farmer tells Bitzer to clean it up - but he makes the mistake of getting Shaun and co to help.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Maze Master Richard Ayoade leads the Holmes family around the maze as they attempt to win precious crystals and not have a major falling out.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Lets Get Cosy in Animal Crossing!
programme.desc: Gems joined by special guest Remy Hii for an Animal Crossing extravaganza! Plus, Tom Nook infiltrates soccer practice, alternative games to play if you like decorating sims and SG helps you build a bigger AC house in Ask SG!

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Regulars Sandi Toksvig and Alan Davies are joined by guests Stephen K Amos, Sara Pascoe and Jason Manford to discuss Plants.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Gwen is delighted when Ron suggests they go for a walk together, but it quickly derails when Gwen is left to babysit and accidentally loses Mr Parkers baby! Meanwhile, Felicity discovers her love for running.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Dont Anger The Destroyer! A Heart-pounding Birthday Party
programme.desc: An uninvited guest appears at Bulmas party! Beerus crashes the party and Vegeta is stunned after memories of the Gods visit to his home planet plague him. He does the only thing he can - ensure Beerus has a good time!

programme.title: Slugterra Ascension
programme.desc: With their own slugs now unable to transform, Eli and Trixie struggle to battle off the monster that is stalking them, trying to snatch Uni. As an exit from the tunnel appears, help arrives from an unusual source.

programme.title: Ninjago Dragons Rising
programme.desc: Lloyd encounters a new elemental master while Sora is forced to choose between her past and Ninjagos future.

programme.title: Iyanu: The Age Of Wonders
programme.desc: 500 years before The Chosen, Yorubaland thrives in the Age of Wonders. When Meje, the embodiment of the seven deadly sins emerges, warriors Dara and Ishe must prevent the Age of Darkness with help from the Divine Ones.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Lightning Tongue Stud / Tree Cannon / Beat The Breath Test
programme.desc: Does wearing a tongue stud increase your chances of being struck by lightning? Can you build a a cannon out of a tree? And Adam and Jamie set out to bust the myth that you can fool the breathalyser.

programme.title: David Strattons Stories Of Australian Cinema
programme.desc: Part 3 is about families: The Castles nuclear family; family of faith in The Devils Playground; Romper Stompers neo-Nazis; immigrants in Head On and crime families from Ned Kelly to Animal Kingdom. (Final)

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: A car accident in the ambulance bay severely injures a single mother. Gates treats a 78-year-old man who refuses life-saving surgery. Morris impresses Claudia and her family, while Neela tells Brenner about her job offer.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: A new student with a violent reputation arrives at Hartley.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: How Dare You Do That To My Bulma! Vegetas Metamorphosis Of Fury!
programme.desc: When even Buu cant land a hit on Beerus, Vegeta steps in to calm the angry God. The other Z fighters step in, but Beerus proves to be a challenge unlike any other. When he threatens Bulma, will Vegeta finally make his move?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: The living toys in Helsings basement have been too noisy! Pierce is sent to investigate, but finds himself shrunk down to lead them into battle!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Baffling Birthday
programme.desc: Ava wants to give Maudie her first proper birthday party but Maudie gets sidetracked by a mystery.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The girls learn to appreciate each otherss style after having to each fight solo.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Can Jamie and Adam make a car so stinky that no one will buy it? Plus The MythBusters recreate the myth of the Racoon Rocket, where a man lighting gasoline in a sewer pipe to eliminate a raccoon became a human cannonball.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Michael Pharoah, Xulio Merino, Topas and Toby Rudolph.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana, Mr Onion, Little Nana and their friends discover a paper star on the ceiling in the little Toy House. In Storyland the friends find a sky full of twinkly stars to wonder about.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: One day, Morts leaf suddenly starts to turn brown. As he and Beep try to change is back, they realise that change is full of new possibilities.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: One day Bop sees the most beautiful butterfly in Hoopla, but when he catches it, it begins to look sad. He asks his friends to help cheer up the butterfly.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector is entranced by the sound of a beautiful voice, will Mole like it too?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain. Bing is disappointed but as they unpack the wheelie bag he realises that they can have their picnic indoors

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is Sports Day with lots of events, including running, jumping and tug of war. Dad tells Peppa that its not the winning that matters but taking part, but she would really like to win a prize.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun decides he wants to have a go at skateboarding and sets about building a skatepark from scrap he finds in the dump. Before too long he gets carried away and suddenly discovers its a bit riskier than he first thought.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey wants to help Dad make Bingos birthday cake, but first she must put away her toys. But nothing can tempt her to clean up, until Dad drops the cake.

programme.title: Blueys Big Play
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo pull out all the stops to try to get Dad off his phone in their first live stage show, brought to life by brilliant puppets and featuring brand new original music.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Mum and Dad have a disagreement, Bluey makes Dad write a love letter to Mum to make up. Now Bluey must find a way to play Grounds Lava with Bingo and deliver the letter to Mum, without squabbling.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Dad always take out the bins. Over a few weeks, Bingo tells Dad about a new kid at kindy who is mean to her and Mum offers some good advice.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Its time for Bluey and Bingo to get out of the bath. But Dad has decided not to tell them what to do and gets roped into a game of Burger Shop.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Muffin is told that she is special by her Dad, she interprets it as an excuse to do anything she wants, which means playing Bluey and Bingos game of Library her way.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want a lick of each others ice cream. But they are so focused on making sure each lick is fair, they dont notice their ice creams are melting.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Grandad is supposed to be resting, but when Bluey and Bingo go to visit him, he makes a run for it with the kids and takes them on a madcap adventure into the bush.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Chloe tries to teach her Dad to improvise and play Blueys game of Octopus at home, he finds it hard to understand or enjoy, until they both realise, they can play it their own way.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: It is Blueys first trip to the cinema, but shes worried that the movie will be too scary. When Bingo starts running amok in the theatre, she must conquer her fear and help Dad out.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Uncle Rad and Frisky accidently turn up to babysit Bluey and Bingo on the same night, they have to work together to make Bluey feel better about babysitter putdowns.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum helps Bluey and Bingo find ways to entertain themselves on a family road trip, while Dad tries to stay ahead of the grey nomad convoy or risk camping near the toilets.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: In the park Bluey meets a new playmate Winnie, but when Bluey wants to invite her and her dad home for breakfast, she learns that adults take a little bit longer to make friends.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey cant get to sleep, so Mum reads her one last story. But they are interrupted by Unicorse, the most annoying hand puppet in the world, whom Bluey tries to reform.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad tries to teach Bluey how to play chess, but Mum thinks she is still too young. When Bingo joins in, the kids make up their own rules, but they still cant beat Dad.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo and Dad must brave a swooping magpie protecting its nest, when they go on a curry swap to Mackenzies house through the park.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum and Dad vow to only finish their boring housework when the kids stop acting silly, but thats never going to happen, so they end up trying the same approach themselves.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum wont let Bingo have Pavlova, so the kids find a way by playing a cheeky game of Cafe in the kitchen. But Dad the chef sets up a competing shop that only serves edamame beans.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo love to videochat with Muffin and Socks so they can all draw pictures together. When Muffin wont give Socks a turn, the kids discover what happens when you hog.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dads accused of fluffing in Blueys face as he climbed out of bed, hes put on trial with Mum as the judge and Bluey and Bingo as witnesses. But what was Bluey doing there?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad agrees to take Bluey and Bingo to the shops to buy an ice-cream if they can get him into the car. Only problem is... hes just entered Ragdoll mode!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey promises her customer Bingo the best tour ever in a game of Whale Watching, but they need Mum and Dad to join in and they are too tired to play after a late night.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Tired of being told what to do, Bluey and Bingo enlist their giant invisible friend to show Mum and Dad whos boss. Now they can do anything they want, until Mum and Dad rebel.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey teaches Bingo how to use magic so she can make Mum play with her, but she forgets to explain the most important rule - never use magic for cheekiness!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad complains about how dissimilar Bluey and Bingo are, Bluey hatches a plan to make them more alike and happily introduces Mini-Bluey!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When a heavy summer rain thunders over the Heeler home, Bluey is determined to dam the water in the front yard, while Mum tries to stop her constantly tracking mud into the house.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Muffin is playing Grouchy Granny on an old mobility scooter at a garage sale, but a real granny wants to buy it!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo teach Unicorse good manners so he can ask Mum on a date, but things go sideways when Unicorse eats a tick.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo would rather explore their holiday hotel room than relax on the beach.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Indy thinks shes no good because her model horse looks like a cow, but Calypso encourages her not to give up.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo pretends to be Boss Blueys new employee in the middle of Dads backyard workout.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: During a friendly game of neighbourhood cricket, the dads struggle to bowl Rusty out.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers and Luckys family get together to watch the big game!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey wants to know why Dad is always bossing her around.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Judo wants to play in the dirt with Bluey and Bingo, but shes not supposed to get dirty!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey asks Dad to help her draw a dragon for her story.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad is pretending to be an estate agent selling the Grannies house to Mum. But Janet and Rita dont want to move out!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want Dad to play two different games, so Dad plays both at the same time.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana finds a set of picture cards on the Toy House kitchen table, which are of Pepi Nana doing her favourite things and she arranges them in a list. In Storyland Pepi Nana does all of her favourite things on her list.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: When Pop tells Beep and Mort about the amazing, magical dream she had the night before, Beep is sad that robots cant dream. Mort, Mae, Uncle Joe and Pop join forces to create a real-life dreamland for Beep.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Hoopla is in a mess after a big storm and Jango thinks its too hard to clean up. So he pretends to be sick and tricks his friends into doing his work for him.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers surprising new sounds and wonderful music one frosty day.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a helium balloon stuck in a tree in the park. They both want to play with it at the same time so Flop makes two strings and they invent a noisy balloon game called Stuck Duckies.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas friend, Pedro Pony, wears glasses. Peppa thinks she might need them too, so Mummy Pig takes her for an eye test. Peppa is disappointed to find she has perfect vision - but that doesnt stop her fabulous sunglasses.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is playing the piano and torturing everyone with his musical inability! When the Flock discover that Bitzer is a virtuoso they decide its time for a party. They devise a plan to borrow the piano from the Farmer.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: New farmer Annie is transporting two wild boars when one of them escapes. She jumps in the river after him and now they both need to be rescued!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly are excited when they learn that Nanny Plum is a Tooth Fairy at night, and go along with her to pick up a little girls tooth. But the little girl is not so little - shes a human and much bigger than them!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Family go skiing on Snowy Mountain. They find lots of their friends there including Mandy Mouse and her mono ski.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce leads an adventure into a cave, but the cadets become trapped by the rising tide. Meanwhile, Frizzy goes in search of a volcano.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Luigis courage teaches the Super Monsters to confront prejudice and embrace kindness.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Cuppa King
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay help Appa get ready to appear on Mr Awans channel to tell the world about his amazing Appa Cuppa! Can they help Appa overcome his camera-shyness?

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie, Nina and Akil are going to the beach. He learns how to deal with scratchy sand, build a sandcastle, and preserve the environment.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: What is the science to making sound? Rachael is experimenting with water levels to create a xylophone instrument from colourful water jars. Discover how sound travels and make music on the way!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Its dress up as your favourite animal day in Wiggle Town, what is your favourite animal? While looking for dress ups, Tsehay and John come across a cow hat, who does it belong to?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks meet a robot that goes beep and wants to be just like them. This episode introduces the EE letter team and the words beep, see, seed, feet, feel and weep.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig takes Peppa, George and Danny Dog to visit Grampy Rabbits lighthouse.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie finds a baby bird in need of a home, she decides to build a special birdhouse.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley helps Seamus and Little Woo take a last-minute holiday without leaving town.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce leads an adventure into a cave, but the cadets become trapped by the rising tide. Meanwhile, Frizzy goes in search of a volcano.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets two wood-burning engines whove never travelled beyond their eucalyptus railway. Thomas agrees to swap jobs with them for the day, but this causes more trouble than he expects.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Marcus build a Birds Nest Shop for all the local birds to visit and take what they need for their birds nests.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Get ready to Wiggle and Learn! Explore the amazing animal kingdom, Do the Monkey and join The Wiggles for singing, dancing, and a game of Simon Says all about animals!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Fernie forgets his blanket.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy and Peppa start a Secret Club - going on secret missions, and doing secret things. In secret. But soon everyone wants to join!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: A grumpy honey badger takes over a savannas main watering hole, so Kwazii challenges her to a digging challenge as a way to utilize her help in digging out a new watering hole for the rest of the animals.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Bluey forgets to put her favourite toy away, cousin Socks grabs it and wont let go! The kids stage a horsey wedding to distract her, with Dad and Uncle Stripe as the horses!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are helping Duggee in the garden when Tag makes friends with a caterpillar. This caterpillar is very hungry, so Tag feeds her all the vegetable leaves theyve been picking. She eats and eats and eats!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Evil Pea get stuck inside a giant bubble together. They float through the air until Supertato and Evil Pea pop the bubble by driving it into a supermarket sign.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Bluey accidentally makes Bingo upset playing a game at dinner, she will do anything to make her happy again - even changing the rules of the game. But nothing seems to work.

programme.title: Daylight Saving Starts
programme.desc: Daylight Saving Starts in NSW, VIC, ACT, TAS and SA. Clocks move forward one hour from 2am AEST to 3am AEDT.

programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Dozens feared dead after an Indonesian boarding school collapses, a powerful earthquake strikes the Philippines, plus why Chinas new K visa for tech workers is causing controversy.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Moving and monitoring dairy cattle without fences; and an epic ride raising awareness about dementia.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Lorna Dunkley and Thomas Oriti present an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Ryan Hoffman, Catherine Murphy and Quentin Hull preview the Melbourne Storm v Brisbane Broncos in the NRL Grand Final and Roosters v Broncos in the NRLW decider in a special from Sydney Olympic Park.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week we set sail to investigate illegal fishing, find out how communities feel about the COP UN Climate Conference possibly coming to our region for the first time, plus an archive of more than 1300 Pacific languages.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas presents a roundup of big stories from across the globe. This week: an aid flotilla enroute to Gaza intercepted as the US unveils a peace proposal, an attack at a UK synagogue, and a quake hits the Philippines.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: When Astrid Jorgensen started Pub Choir in a small Brisbane bar, she never imagined she would be filling halls across the world eight years later.

programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Ryan Hoffman, Catherine Murphy and Quentin Hull preview the Melbourne Storm v Brisbane Broncos in the NRL Grand Final and Roosters v Broncos in the NRLW decider in a special from Sydney Olympic Park.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The rise and rise of Australian grown avocados; How drought led sheep and cropping farmers to flower growing; the small-scale, traditional mixed farmer producing award winning food; and the monthly weather outlook.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of scans under urgent review after a patient with advanced cancer died following a bungle at a Queensland hospital, a campaign to make sheep shearing an Olympic sport, and the outback rescue of a cheeky sausage dog.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: An uneasy calm has returned to Iran. In June, the country was in the grip of a 12-day war as Israel targeted Irans nuclear facilities. Jonathan Miller is in the Islamic Republic to find out if the world is any safer. (Final)

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers is joined by Jacob Greber, Samantha Maiden and Tom McIlroy to discuss PNG approves the landmark defence treaty with Australia, the response to the triple-0 failure, hospital funding, nuclear energy and net zero.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: A new record high for house prices as the governments first home buyer scheme kicks in. Plus aiming for half electric cars in a decade, why Australias climate tsar warns a road user tax will keep EVs in the slow lane.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The rise and rise of Australian grown avocados; How drought led sheep and cropping farmers to flower growing; the small-scale, traditional mixed farmer producing award winning food; and the monthly weather outlook.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: In the Italian town of Capannori, about 50,000 residents live according to the zero-waste principle, producing almost no garbage. Plus a Ukrainian soldiers widow has her deceased husbands child via artificial insemination.

programme.title: Fancy Fruit
programme.desc: Finger limes are native to Australia and are highly prized by top chefs. Commercially growing them is relatively new. But already local producers are facing competition from growers in Europe and the Americas.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Get a head start on the week. Chas and John break down the latest from the US, as Donald Trump tests the limits of Presidential power using Executive Orders, tariffs, government agencies and the Courts to try and get his way.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
